flawed_nl_solution:
If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=1020>>1020.
The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 1020+600 = <<1020+600=1620>>1620
The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 1020-200 = 820 people at the fair last year.
In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 1620 of this and next year + 820 of last year = <<1620+820=2440>>2440
#### 2440

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 1020. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
